By nature, this course requires many online digital resources and has a lot of teaching notes. Online teaching allow us to stay at home where we have more space and flexibility to access to teaching materials.

We can watch the videos clearly and put down our questions in the chatbox whenever we want to, and the teacher will not be interrupted. And those who are shy are also willing to speak up online rather than in class at CUHK. And we have better discussion online!

column2: It saves travel time and cost. This is important because this class may overrun sometimes. I have another class after this class and the classroom is located quite faraway from the classroom of this class. Thus by online learning I do not have to rush to the other classroom after this class and can have more time to rest between classes.  Online learning is also convenient to keep everybody on the same page, which makes conversations easier. Another thing is that I personally think that I am more confident to speak in class when I am in an online meeting at home, comparing to real time classes in the classroom setting.

Although the university has made their maximum effort for the online learning to be as identical as the face to face learning possible. However, online learning simply can't replace face to face learning as due to the frequent connection problems, and some professors not being able to make full use of the system 'zoom'. Students including myself was easily distracted by other student's misuse of the platform such as not being able to mute themselves if they are in a noisy condition which overlaps with the voice of the professor and once again wasting the class time by trying to resolve the situation. Not being able to use the white board to actively explain and solve the problems were another essential issues, as the nature of accounting consists of solving the questions by hand hence typing it out was not an ideal way and sometimes thus it was unclear.

I can find reference and read books to check and ask question.  Very hard to do it physically.   Also, I live very far away and I can sit-in all courses which help (as many of the course are related to each other).  For example, the history of philosophy has a few lecture on Socrates and pre-Socrates and even Zhungzi.  So is Sartre and certain part of Buddhism.  I think some recording of the lecture for others to look at is very good for those studying part-time master.I hope also in the future zoom (may I suggest a better secure system) so we can easy arrange online meeting with my group mates.  Of course some physical discussion is important.  But sometimes it is hard to get all together, unlike full time undergrad or postgrad.  We are part-time and fixing time is hard.

column2: everybody can really engage in the discussion.

Leilah is a wonderful teacher and she made great efforts to help us get good outcomes through Zoom. 1. She prepared very clear PPT with audio, so we can learn the contents before the lecture, which is quite helpful! It is better than in-person lecture. 2. She organizes the course very well. She lists five problematics to training our thinking in each lecture. The same problematics, different authors , which makes me think, think and think. It's difficult for me, but quite interesting!!!3. She will encourage us to talk more, during the lecture, because we already read the readings, watched the videos, and learned the PPT with her audio. So, we can discuss a lot during the lecture. Her way to inspire we students to think and talk is quite useful! 4. She recap the ideas very well.I can't show my thanks to Leilah, an excellent teacher!

Matthews made us all turn on our video cameras all the time. This actually INCREASED participation in class compared to offline classes, and people who usually wouldn't speak up used the chat function to discuss. Matthew's policy of not-critisizing jokes, and even encouraging people who he disagreed with made this class a pleasure to be in, helped us form bonds even on the online platform, and have meaningful discussion and debates about the topic using the chat function.

Prof. Wong made very good use of the possibilities of online collaboration tools. Our group discussions were usually led on 'paper' in written form, not through discussions on zoom, which I find a bit sad, nonetheless it was an effective method to exchange ideas. Since everyone can write and read their classmates' comments at the same time, it might be even more effective than in class discussions when the group members are very quiet.He (and the whole UGFN team) also provided a large amount of online resources to complement the readings.

Unlike traditional crass-room, the teacher can keep record of every weekly lesson for reference which missing students also can benefit from.

column2: Reduced the time for commuting.

Students give a lot more responses on Zoom than in class. Of course this can be due to two reasons. First, one doesn't stand out that much (physically) when asking a question or responding to other classmates. Second, typing out questions and responses is an easier for students  to express themselves I believe.Also, something very important to someone who is not good at maths and sciences like me really like panotop videos. When I cannot catch up, I can replay the video again and again until I understand. I could also slow down the speed of the video. I cannot do this in a live lesson or to ask the Prof. to slow down just because of me.I think some students who are good at Maths and Science simply play the panotop with a 1.75 speed. Which is good for them, they understand the lesson material quickly and fastplaying the video saves time for students!

多点思考

1. Part time student can't really make it to CUHK on time so that some usually miss 15-30 minutes of the lesson, but now I can attend my lesson even when I have to work over time or on my way home. 2. Usually, travelling time for attending physical lesson is rather torturing and eats up students' rest time, causing low health quality and therefore effectiveness of learning. With online teaching system, I can relax at home without miss any lesson whenever I am feeling not well.3. Some part time students might have business trip but still doesn't want to miss any lesson, now that online lesson is available, they can attend lesson anywhere.

column2: watch videos

(1) Part-time students can try to be on-time anywhere as the class time is too early for students working in Hong Kong Island side to come to campus in CUHK in N.T. Therefore, we can fully enjoy the class, without missing any critical part. (2) Learning online allows us to drop notes during class as the screen shows the content clearer than the projector screen in class. (3) Practicing online learning and presentation indeed could be good practice for the new trend of workplace need. I feel I am more technically ready for virtual interaction and presentation. (4) Sora has much to teach, which are all very insightful and practical, the online learning allows the class to accept overrun as we probably are having the class at home. (On a related note, it will be great if Sora teaches more class, OR with more class time! Super insightful! Best teacher I had met in CC)

1. PRO CHEUNG 能夠在課堂上有效地運用電子教學技術, 讓學生們充分透過單向式, 互動式的方法進行學習，有師生及生生之學習模式，與平日在課室的學習沒有很大的差別。2.  因為疫情的關係，對大學教師及學生來說，利用網上教學都對彼此有利，也省卻了平日交通來回的時間。3. 我覺得所有同學都樂意參與網上課堂，對於小組報告這一環節，同學們都自行運用空餘時間進行zoom 的討論，同樣達到互動溝通的效果，每組的報告都十分順暢自然有效。4. 本人覺得中文大學能夠迅速找尋到zoom 電子教學方法，值得讚賞，對於突然其來的影響，能夠有效迅速地找尋方法解決代替是最重要的.

column2: By using Zoom in this course, professor has made good use of this software to interact with all the students. There are more interactions and communication about teaching and learning which help us learn better.

As the lessons are all conducted utilising ICT tools, I do not see any difference between attending the lessons on-site and online. I brought with me my laptop before the school suspension anyway so that I could save all the links to the programmes and my login details on my device without requiring to copy and remember all of them. By attending classes at home, students can enjoy such convenience without the need to access the computers back at the university and risk not logging out from the applications. Also, not only do we save our shoulders in carrying our laptop to school, but also we save time and costs from commuting.

Paul made use of a lot of interactive online websites or applications to facilitate teaching and learning. The use of these resources is very effective and even saves time in teaching. Paul is always well-prepared for the lessons.
Very interactive and engaging lesson. Apart from the course objectives, I also learn a lot about e-learning, which is more useful then the ICT course.

The course is about Contemporary English Language Teaching Issues. IT is definitely one of the hottest topics. Multimodal learning also require IT as well. The laptop at home is better and faster than the computer at CUHK which make learning smoother for me. :)
Very interactive
As this course is about e-learning and teaching, it is a good demonstration for tutor presenting how effective and efficient the e-platforms are.
flexible learning time , can preview the teaching content first
This course still runs smoothly despite the influence of coronavirus, under the professional teaching of Professor Sze.
save my time and energy from going to the uni when online teaching produce a very similar result in terms of the content to teach, I absorb the content even better than at uni in the classroom

As this course is about the use of IT tools in English teaching, having the course online has showcased Professor’s creativity in carrying out the lesson very effectively, which sets a very good example for me to do the same thing for my students during this class suspension period .
I can attend the lessons on time, as I have heard that some people feel very difficult to attend the lesson on time if they need to go to the main campus on Saturday morning.

With him always answers our emails and he even prepared additional Whatsapp number specifically for student-teacher communication, it makes me less stressd out, being aware that he's always there to answer our uncertainties in different class formatting.

The on-line system was sufficient to replicate about 70-80% of what a professor/instructor can generate in the physical classroom. The lack of being in the same physical space obviously made spontaneous response and discussion a little more difficult. However, discussion and participation were often prompted and always encouraged/welcome by the professor.The online teaching saved a lot of travel time to and from the campus. The recording of the sessions also provided a faithful and viable source to review the covered material later in the semester.

Firstly, the workload for this course is too much.  One assignment takes us a week to complete.  There are a total of 5 assignments and an examination.  However, the course outline changed in the middle of the semester.  The final examination has been changed to an exam paper that required to be created by ourselves and a PowerPoint presentation for 20-30minutes.  The workload of this course is definitely not corresponding to 3 credit units.  Moreover, the assignment is just directly copied from the course of ECLT 5740 Spring 2020.  The reason why I notice is that the heading of the homework is not even changed when distributing to us on the blackboard.  I hope you can take TA SHI Shangcheng's attitude into serious consideration.   He is very irresponsible and impolite.  For the homework feedback, he had feedback of "your understanding is totally wrong.  At least, you should read its WIki webpage beforehand".  After that, I have searched from Wikipedia, and quote the information to him.  He just replies to me this is the first time he knows about this knowledge.  For the other homework, my coursemates and I found the problem of when we ask for guidance from SHI Shangcheng, he just asked us to search it online or ask the AWS Service Support (We are working on AWS Instance).

This module utilised many electronic features which were very helpful to students. The written part of the assessment was changed from paper-based to electronic based. In relation to Mediation, the best part is, thankfully, students were not required to use the cumbersome, halfbaked, buggy Lockdown browser. The same could not be said for Arbitration though. In addition, unlike previous years, students were permitted to use the internet to do their research for case analysis (aka the grid) for mediation case analysis, although it was of little help, the change accurately reflects true legal research in practice. This part of the module, together with our Conference Skills assessment, may well be the best example of what PCLL should be, that is, letting students to have a true taste of being a lawyer in practice.

This module is divided into two parts, namely Conference Skills and Opinion Writing. In relation to the Opinion Writing, there is little to no difference to what is expected.   The same cannot be said for Conference Skills. This module utilised many electronic features which were very helpful to students. The written part of the assessment was changed from paper-based to electronic based and the best part is, thankfully, students were not required to use the cumbersome, halfbaked, buggy Lockdown browser. In addition, unlike previous years, students were permitted to use the internet to do their research for case analysis (aka the grid), although it was of little help, the change accurately reflects true legal research in practice. This part of the module, together with our ADR mediation assessment, may well be the best example of what PCLL should be, that is, letting students to have a taste of being a lawyer in practice.

The recorded lecture is very helpful, given that I could refer to the part that I could not comprehend during the online lecture. The fact that Prof. Gallagher would unmute us from time to time so that we could participate in the discussion helps to facilitate understanding.

Firstly, the online teaching can allow more than one students to share their thoughts at the same time through the "chat" function, and then the teacher will respond them together. It saves more time and we don't need to wait one by one like what we have during the in-class lectures.   Secondly, it cost less on the transportation every day, though the expensive rents are wasted especially for non-local students.   Thirdly, online teaching saves the time of transportation and students may have more time to relax themselves before classes rather than rushing from their working places or homes to schools to occupy better seats. Hence, the students may be more comfortable and relaxed when having classes so that they may be more concentrated rather than always being under high pressure and nervous.

The online teaching and learning arrangement is fabulous because it is very effective for learning, especially for part-time students that we could watch the recorded lessons again.  The professors also arranged final revision classes so that we could watch the recorded lessons again and again. It's great for our studies! Furthermore, the exam was launched through LockDown Browser in which we could stay in the office / at home to complete exam. This arrangement saved us so much time (and probably also saved much human resources and classroom facility from the management perspective from the School).  I hope the Faculty could continue to provide this online teaching and learning option so that we can study according to our own pace and balance our work and study. Thank you very much!

No good features. Especially in the review session, the explanation towards the answer that professor expected in the answer paper is pretty simple, at least much more simply than other courses.

The recorded lecture allowed me to refer back to the part that I did not understand completely after the course, the prompt reply on email by the professor also helps a lot. Not to mention that the chat function allows the students to raise question instantly.

Firstly, the teacher always interacts with students and he likes to share his thoughts with us and always asks questions and respects all of the voices from us. It is likely that students can be more involved and active when having online lectures than that in the classroom because we cannot see each other and even if we make some mistakes, other students will not know who I am. Under this circumstance, students may more likely to share their opinions and speak out.  Secondly, he tries the "chat" function of Zoom and it works well and fluently.  Some general benefits of online teaching: It cost less on transportation every day, though the expensive rents are wasted especially for non-local students.   Besides, online teaching saves the time of transportation, and students may have more time to relax before classes rather than rushing from their working places or homes to schools to occupy better seats. Hence, the students may be more comfortable and relaxed when having classes so that they may be more concentrated rather than always being under high pressure and nervous.

column2: I am very grateful to have received comments regarding my assignments through Blackboard. The prof also launched a Whataspp group and we were able to learn from the prof's comments and I was so happy to share my views and findings through Whataspp group too. Although I was doing part-time and was not able to attend the morning session most of the time, I could also present and share my views during a Sat session and was able to learn from other classmates in the breakout room. This was a very interactive environment! The online teaching and learning arrangement is fabulous because it is very effective for learning, especially for part-time students that we could watch the recorded lessons again.  Another great arrangement is that we could form into teams and work together using Google Doc and our team also discussed our project by Zoom during our free time. Although there was one student who did not participate much, we were able to complete the project (and I wrote the majority and proofread the whole group project, and I am glad that I learn a lot too).  I hope the Faculty could continue to provide this online teaching and learning option so that we can study according to our own pace and balance our work and study. *** The professor is fabulous! One good feature of online teaching is reduced travel time. Students do not have to run from one side of the campus to another side to get to their lectures or tutorials. Through online learning students just need to log-in through Zoom and they are already in class. Additionally, another beneficial feature is the anonymity behind the screen online teaching grants.
The use of break-out rooms on zoom for class discussions during tutorials.

column2: I liked how Professor Knight encouraged class contribution during tutorials. He also made review lectures for each week, and I really appreciated the effort he put into consolidating our understanding. He also made the effort to answer all of our questions.   I also really liked how he encouraged us to read the cases and he uploaded the cases onto blackboard. It was much more convenient and I didn't have to worry whether I was reading the correct appeal / version.
